situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The bee is a software developer, and is currently in Venice. The crow tears down the castle that belongs to the llama. The gadwall is named Blossom. The swan has three friends, and is currently in Brazil. The swan is named Chickpea. The fish does not acquire a photograph of the bee. The reindeer does not build a power plant near the green fields of the stork. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: The shark unquestionably trades one of the pieces in its possession with the wolf, in the case where the swan suspects the truthfulness of the shark. Rule2: The swan will not suspect the truthfulness of the shark if it (the swan) has fewer than three friends. Rule3: The swan will suspect the truthfulness of the shark if it (the swan) is in Italy at the moment. Rule4: Here is an important piece of information about the swan: if it has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the gadwall's name then it suspects the truthfulness of the shark for sure. Rule5: One of the rules of the game is that if the reindeer does not build a power plant close to the green fields of the stork, then the stork will never shout at the shark. Rule6: If at least one animal tears down the castle that belongs to the llama, then the stork shouts at the shark. Rule7: The bee does not acquire a photograph of the shark, in the case where the fish acquires a photograph of the bee. Rule8: If the swan has a card with a primary color, then the swan does not suspect the truthfulness of the shark. Rule3 is preferred over Rule2. Rule3 is preferred over Rule8. Rule4 is preferred over Rule2. Rule4 is preferred over Rule8. Rule6 is preferred over Rule5.
question: Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the shark trade one of its pieces with the wolf?
label: unknown
